title: Set admin credentials to AnuragSingh/Anurag@123 and add password change settings in admin dashboard

requirements.summary: Update hardcoded admin credentials in AuthContext to username 'AnuragSingh' and password 'Anurag@123'
acceptanceCriteria: Logging in at /admin/login with username 'AnuragSingh' and password 'Anurag@123' succeeds and redirects to /admin dashboard.
Logging in with any other username/password combination fails with an error message.
The AuthContext default credentials are set to username='AnuragSingh' and password='Anurag@123'.

file_operations.description: Update the hardcoded credentials object to set username to 'AnuragSingh' and password to 'Anurag@123'. Modify the default credentials used in the login validation logic to match these exact values. Ensure sessionStorage persists these credentials correctly after successful login.

requirements.summary: Add Settings section to admin dashboard allowing the admin to change username and password with validation
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Settings' tab or section is visible in the admin dashboard after login.
The settings form contains fields: new username, current password, new password, confirm new password.
Submitting with a wrong current password shows a clear error message and does not update credentials.
Submitting with mismatched new password and confirm password shows a validation error.
On successful save, the updated username and password are applied immediately â€” logging out and logging in again with the new credentials works.
A success notification is displayed after credentials are successfully changed.

file_operations.description: Add a `changeCredentials` function to the AuthContext that accepts newUsername, currentPassword, newPassword parameters. Implement validation logic to verify the currentPassword matches the stored password before updating. Update the credentials in both the context state and sessionStorage. Return success/error status from this function to support UI feedback.

Add a new Settings section or tab to the admin dashboard UI. Create a settings form with controlled input fields for: new username (text), current password (password with show/hide toggle), new password (password with show/hide toggle), and confirm new password (password with show/hide toggle). Implement form validation to check that new password and confirm password match. Call the AuthContext changeCredentials function on form submission. Display success toast/alert on successful credential update and error messages for validation failures or incorrect current password. Use shadcn/ui components (Input, Button, Label, Card, Alert) for consistent styling.
